page.title: 12Laverstock social hostelries
page.content: The Duck Inn, the only Public House in Laverstock, is not the kind of pub one expects to find in a rural village setting. It is a modern pub owned by Gibbs Mews, Salisbury.{Its apt name is {the result prolific species living {nearby.}There is a lounge and public bar.The landlord, Mr. Gould, provides bar meals and barbecues in the summer. There is a large garden at the rear of the pub, being particularly suited to this purpose. The pub offers the usual entertainments of darts and pool. Nearby the Laverstock and Ford Sports Club also serves the area. It is run by a committee elected by members. Mr. Delargy, Club Steward, says his job, besides looking after the bars, is trying to keep people happy. The club is spacious, with TV, snooker,lounge and a dance hall. Outside there are facilities for football and cricket.
